content.description: A toy rocket moves in the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>y</mi></math>-direction with an acceleration given by the equation <math alttext="a equals, 50 minus 2 times t squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi></math> is time in seconds, and <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>a</mi></math> is in <math alttext="meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. At <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, the toy rocket is located at position <math alttext="y equals 10 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mtext> m</mtext></math> and has a velocity <math alttext="v equals 6 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>v</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn><mtext></mtext><mspace width="0.15em"></mspace><mtext> m/s</mtext></math>.
content.question:
In the time interval from <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> to <math alttext="t equals 5 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mtext> s</mtext></math>, which choice correctly describes how the position and velocity are changing?
PositionVelocityADecreasesDecreasesBDecreasesIncreasesCIncreasesDecreasesDIncreasesIncreases

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
